mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol.service.directory
Class DirectoryServerInitializer.DirectoryServer_ControlLogic

java.lang.Object
  mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.ControlLogic
      mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol.IdolInitializer.Console_ControlLogic
          mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol.service.ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic
              mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.idol.service.directory.DirectoryServerInitializer.DirectoryServer_ControlLogic
All Implemented Interfaces:
Advertiser, Clock.AlarmHandler, Console.CommandHandler, Selectable.Handler
Enclosing class:
DirectoryServerInitializer
public static class DirectoryServerInitializer.DirectoryServer_ControlLogic
extends ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic
implements Advertiser, Clock.AlarmHandler

DirectoryServer_ControlLogic expects a client to be an advertiser or a consumer.

An advertiser supplies its ServerContact and description, a String, using Advertiser.advertise(ServerContact, String, Integer).

A consumer requests the Field named DirectoryFields.DIRECTORY_FIELDNAME. That Field is a map of from the ServerContact address of the advertising client to String.

As advertments age, DirectoryServer_ControlLogic removes entries from the DIRECTORY_FIELD.

TODO: This implementation implements QoS by limiting the rate at which it applies changes to the authoritiative State. That makes it more complicated that it could be. Consider simplifying it by applying changes to authoritative State as they occur. Let the ViewInterpreters limit the rate of updates to the clients.

Field Detail

_advertiseContentsAlarm

private Clock.Alarm _advertiseContentsAlarm
When _advertiseAlarm expires, this Directory server applies all of the MapTransactions that are contained in _transactions to the DIRECTORY field of the authoritative State. This will probably cause a Projector to send a directory update to the consumers.

_advertiseContentsInterval

private int _advertiseContentsInterval
Apply changes to the directory no more frequently than this number of milliseconds. It's the period of _advertiseContentsAlarm.

_ttlAlarm

private Clock.Alarm _ttlAlarm
When _ttlAlarm expires, this Directory server begins to remove the the oldest entry of the DIRECTORY field of the authoritative State. The transaction completes when _advertiseContentsAlarm expires.

_expirations

private SortedMap _expirations
Maps Long to List of ServerContact. The key is the time at which the directory entries for the ServerContacts expire. Time is measured in milliseconds since the Epoch (midnight, January 1, 1970).

_advertiserExpiration

private Map _advertiserExpiration
Maps ServerContact to Long. The key is the ServerContact of an advertiser. The value is the expiration time of the client's advertisement. Time is in milliseconds since the Epoch.

_updateLock

private final Object _updateLock
_updateLock is the semaphore for collecting and applying changes to authoritative State.

_transactions

private final MapTransactions _transactions
_transactions maintains the order of changes to be applied to the advertisers field of the authoritative State. Each change is a pair <ServerContact, String>. The changes are applied to authoritative State and cleared every time _advertiseContentsAlarm expires.

Changes to _transactions are controlled by _updateLock.

Constructor Detail

DirectoryServerInitializer.DirectoryServer_ControlLogic

public DirectoryServerInitializer.DirectoryServer_ControlLogic(Properties p)
                                                        throws EntityInitializer.InitializationException
DirectoryServer_ControlLogic accepts advertisements from advertisers (service clients that wish to advertise) and disseminates the advertisements to consumers (clients that wish to know about those advertisements).

It exposes the advertise(ServerContact, String, Integer) method to advertisers.

The property idol.directory.advertiseContents.interval is the rate at which DirectoryServer_ControlLogic sends directory updates to consumers. It is measured in milliseconds. It must be a positive integer.

Parameters:
p - the properties of this DirectoryServer_ControlLogic
Throws:
EntityInitializer.InitializationException - when idol.directory.advertiseContents.interval is either missing or not an integer greater than zero.
Method Detail

projectorReadyIndication

public void projectorReadyIndication(ServerSideFSM fsm)
Perform the actions of the super class, then start _advertiseContentsAlarm if it hasn't already been started.

Overrides:
projectorReadyIndication in class ControlLogic
Parameters:
fsm - the new connection to a client

advertise

public Object advertise(ServerContact contact,
                        String description,
                        Integer ttl)
Accept an advertisement from some client. Ignore advertisements with non-positive TTLs. The advertisement will be included in the next directory update. It will persist from the next directory update until the directory update following the expiration of its TTL.

TODO: Consider throwing an Exception when ttl ≤ 0.

Specified by:
advertise in interface Advertiser
Parameters:
contact - the contact address of the client
description - text that briefly describes the information offered by the advertiser
ttl - the length of the advertisement in milliseconds
Returns:
null

handle

public void handle(Clock.Alarm m)
Process the expiration of _advertiseContentsAlarm and _ttlAlarm; delgate to the super class for all other alarms.

When m is _advertiseContentsAlarm, apply all of the transactions in _transactions to the authoritative State. Reschedule _ttlAlarm.

When m is _ttlAlarm, place one Remove transaction into _transactions for each advertisment that has expired.

Specified by:
handle in interface Clock.AlarmHandler
Overrides:
handle in class ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic
Parameters:
m - an alarm that expired

scheduleTTLAlarm

private void scheduleTTLAlarm(long now)
Schedule the non-recurring _ttlAlarm for remainder of the life of the next-expiring advertisement in the directory. Do nothing if there are no directory entries.
